org.rocketproplab.marginalstability.flightcomputer.hal

Interface LSM9DS1.RegisterValue

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LSM9DS1.AccelerometerScale, LSM9DS1.FIFOMode, LSM9DS1.GyroScale, LSM9DS1.ODR
    Enclosing class:
    LSM9DS1

    public static interface LSM9DS1.RegisterValue
    An interface to make accessing each value of a register easier. The getValueMask() returns a bitmask of what section of the register should be read and the getValueLSBPos() method returns how many bits to the left of the LSB the LSB of the value is.
    Author:
    Max Apodaca

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getValueLSBPos()
      Get how many bits to the left of the register's LSB the LSB of the value is.
      int getValueMask()
      Get a mask for the register in which this value is in.
      int ordinal()
      The value associated with the given register value.

    • Method Detail

      • getValueMask

        int getValueMask()
        Get a mask for the register in which this value is in. The mask will only cover the specified value.
        For instance a register with three values aabbbccc would mean that value a has a mask of 0b11000000;
        Returns:
        the mask for this value for its register

      • getValueLSBPos

        int getValueLSBPos()
        Get how many bits to the left of the register's LSB the LSB of the value is.
        For instance if we have a register with three values aabbbccc the LSBPos for value b would be 3 as the LSB of b is three bits to the left of the LSB of the register as a whole. The LSBPos of c would be 0 and the LSBPos of a would be 6.
        Returns:
        how many bits to the left of the register's LSB the LSB of the value is

      • ordinal

        int ordinal()
        The value associated with the given register value. Setting the appropriate bits in the value's register to this value will result in application of the value.
        If this instance corresponds to a value of 01 for a in the register aabbbccc then ordinal would return 0b01.

        NOTE: the implementation relies on enums which means the enum values must be ordered correctly to yield a correct return value for ordinal. If the enum has 2 members A_0 and A_1 and A_0 should have value 0 then A_0 must be the first element in the enum.
        Returns:
        the value of this value
